idea-plugin.name: Quick Mock
idea-plugin.description: Allows you to quickly create mock objects from within a test class.
idea-plugin.change-notes: <dl> <dt>1.3.2</dt> <dd>fix mock generation for union types (#30)</dd> <dd>fix regression: existing mocks are not regenerated anymore (#29)</dd> <dd>fix type hints for `mixed` properties (#28)</dd> <dt>1.3.1</dt> <dd>colliding inherited properties are now handled (#26)</dd> <dt>1.3.0</dt> <dd>aliased imports are now prophesized correctly</dd> <dt>1.2.1</dt> <dd>updated meta information</dd> <dt>1.2.0</dt> <dd>do not regenerate mocks if already present (issue #18)</dd> <dd>added configuration for addition of doc blocks (issue #15)</dd> <dd>also add primitives as members of the test case (issue #14)</dd> <dd>provide no intention for classes without constructor (issue #13)</dd> <dt>1.1.0</dt> <dd>added ObjectProphecy doc (issue #8)</dd> <dd>show intention if there are whitespaces between parenthesis (issue #7)</dd> <dd>show intention not only between parenthesis (issue #6)</dd> <dd>added whitespace between mocks and subject creation (issue #5)</dd> <dd>do not mock primitives anymore (issue #4)</dd> <dt>1.0.2</dt> <dd>added "->reveal()" to constructor arguments (issue #1)</dd> <dt>1.0.1</dt> <dd>added gradle publishing support</dd> <dt>1.0</dt> <dd>initial release</dd> </dl
